intro: Adenia mukengensis, commonly known as the Mukengensis Adenia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae, which includes many tropical flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, large heart-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, showy flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within dense rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
